definition: to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

sentences.english: The passenger carrying capacity of a tramcar is nominal figure listed in gazette schedules.
sentences.chinese: 电車的载客量是宪报刊登的名义上數字。

sentences.english: Jeepneys are a familiar sight on the streets of Manila.
sentences.chinese: 载客吉普车是马尼拉街头的常见景观。

sentences.english: These steamers are used for conveying passengers on rivers.
sentences.chinese: 这些轮船是在江上用以载客的。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's minibuses are licensed to carry a maximum of 16 seated passengers.
sentences.chinese: 按牌照规定，本港的小型巴士最多可载客16人。

sentences.english: Boat cover Chuan Peng, ferry passengers.
These steamers are used for conveying passengers on the rivers.
sentences.chinese: 这些轮船是用来在江河上载客的。

sentences.english: For instance, only Tokyo has a subway system that carries more people than its buses.
sentences.chinese: 例如，只有东京的地铁载客量超过公共汽车。

definition: running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
